description:
Really great!

Chicken Sandwich - superb, lightly fried, really juicy 
enjoyed all the beers we tried
Duck tacos - yumm nice
author: Mike J.

description:
The Impossible burger was impossible to get through.

The end.

Ok, ok...not really, because I hate 1 liner reviews.

After my disappointing experience at the highly rated Fermentation Lab, I asked my meat loving friends who've tried the Impossible Burger IF it's supposed to have an unappetizingly mushy, stringy texture with a lingering acrid aftertaste: https://bit.ly/2LY63kJ.

"No!" they all said.

So, I'm going to assume the Impossible patty served to me here was well past its prime.

I had to force myself to eat it because I just forked over $16 for it but I gave up 1/3rds the way in.

The duck fat fries (+$2 upgrade) were thick and crunchy with an indulgent richness. Too bad they were covered in enough salt to give me instant cankles...I'm talking about a blanket of salt covered each fry so it was hard to enjoy more than a couple.

Either I went on a really, really off day or I needed a keg beforehand.

Because drunchies.

(Two stars for the food but bumping it up to three stars because the staff was nice and there's nothing like this in the mid-market area.)
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Went there for drinks before dinner. The place is a regular SF gastropub with some classic beer selection. I like beer but ended up drinking wine that night.

They menu is good over and perfect for vegetarians/vegans. Our order of fries took forever to come out but boy was it was worth it!

Does it standout? Nope. Is it worth making a trip? Not unless they have a beer that you'll get nowhere else.
author: Nidhi M.

description:
Stopped here for dinner before a show at the Orpheum.  It was very convenient to both Bart and the theater.  My daughter really wanted to try the Impossible Burger (thumbs up for that!) and I just wanted a quick bite with my wine.  I ended up getting the Ahi poke, which was good.  Both meals were about $17, which is pretty par for SF.
Bartenders were friendly and helpful.  It was pretty crowded at 7:15 on a Thursday, but we found a seat in the back.  They have tables along one wall, seating at the bar, and two areas for group seating with moveable seats/tables in the front and back.
Good wine and beer selection, and a good food selection for a bar.  Plus they were fast.  I would go back.
author: Lydia C.

description:
I've been a couple times now but just for drinks.

The selection of beers is not bad but I don't think anything really stood out for me.

Finding a place to sit can be a bit of a chore at times but if you're persistent and come at the right time, it'll be fine.

The service has been so-so. I don't feel like anyone was going out of their way to make me feel comfortable (which is fine sometimes) and if there are locals around, it might be a while before you get a pour.

Finally, the crowd is the typical tech crowd you see around SF these days which, needless to say, is a put off.

I would definitely give it another go and try the food sometime though.
author: Art O.

description:
This place has a ridiculous selection of beer on tap and has some yummy food too! 

This place has a few TVs and a nice atmosphere if you are looking for a chill spot to meet with a couple of friends (a couple of couch areas in the front or back) watch a game (bartop) or go on a date (two top high tables) something. Somethings to keep in mind:  not a huge place/on the narrow side, TVs are high up/on the smaller side and the place is kind if dark with an intimate /speakeasy vibe. 

I had the most incredible burger here for the first time and it was surprisingly good! If you don't like vegan/vegetarian items that mimic the texture of meat too closely than this is not for you! 

Cheese Plate- This is a large plate that is great to share. Comes with a variety of cheeses, olives and jams. 

If you are not sure what beer to choose from the extensive list or chalkboard, the bartenders are really great at pairing your taste to a beer!
author: Nina M.

description:
A small place with great beer and food!  It is right next to our apartment and were very excited to have found a great spot next to us.  There is a large assortment of beer.  The pickled veggies are fantastic, would highly recommend.  The smoked pork belly as well, you can taste the smokiness and great flavor and almost reminded me of bacon.  The burger and fries are great as well.  A great place to go before a show at the theater as well.  

We are very happy to find a great neighborhood spot!
author: Lauren S.

description: Best beer place in the downtown. They are so friendly and awesome :) they help us a lot ....
author: Ozan U.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco and decided to get a drink. I found Fermentation lab online and looked like a good place to chill for an hr or two. Decoration was industrial/modern type of thing, very common now days, so didn't really made any big impression but over all is nice. 

I ordered couple beers and they were really good, not a single complaint about it. Kitchen was closed, so unfortunately I wasn't able to try their food. 

Ok place to visit.
author: Issac R.

description: Love this place! The beer selection is fantastic. Always something new. And the food is yummy! I'm not a vegan but the vegan Mac and cheese is my favorite! The staff is awesome super friendly and they give great recommendations of you don't know what you want to drink. Great place to meet friends for an after work Meetup or even before going to a show! Check it out!
author: Ela B.

description: Great craft beer and wine establishment with a hip atmosphere and superbly friendly bar staff.  Great crowd and awesome food! Great place to hang wine friends afterwork or a an evening out!
author: Izabela R.

description:
Three of us had lunch here recently for the first time.
Main objective:  try the Impossible Burger

Our assessment:  The Impossible Burger is pretty darn good!
We all liked it.  Flavor, texture, everything.
The chicken torpedo was also very good.
And the dinner size fries were exceptional.

Overall excellent meal and we will be back soon to try more menu items.
author: Lewis C.

description:
Simple and relaxing beer joint on busy Market street (sketchy neighborhood in the late night hours; have your ride planned and ready to go). 

The beer selection was good, the associate behind the counter was easy on the eyes and in conversation. 

Seating is limited but at 10pm it seemed bountiful. Probably because the homeless crowd is the most populated on the streets at this time and they often make it difficult to enjoy an easy walk around from bar to bar. Uber couldn't come get us fast enough (I don't mind being asked for money but I do get nervous when being yelled at with hands flying). 

I liked this place very much and would love to do some day drinking here. I love to do day drinking anywhere but this place would be nice and relaxing. 

What's even better about this place - for a point of reference, if you're in the area to see a show at the Orpheum, stop here afterwards for a night cap! 

By the time I got back to my hotel room I had an email receipt for my purchases. Gotta love technology these days. 
Cheers!
author: J.R. S.

description:
Fermented Veggies = a lil touch of spice in just enough fermentation. 

Chicken Bites = thoroughly enjoyed enough to order two. The house made dipping ranch is delish.

Cider on Tap = Fresh and crisp

Vegan Mac and Cheese = A bit dry and seasoned mildly.

Great ambiance. We will return!
author: Gaya G.

description: Really awesome bar located right near the Civic Center Bart station.  The place isn't big, but they've got an excellent beer selection as well as food offerings.  The bartender are really friendly and make it feel really welcoming.  The atmosphere is also very relaxed too.  I would definitely recommend the duck sliders, very tasty!  As for the beer, just ask or select what sounds good to you, they've got a lot of great craft beers on tap.  Overall, this is a fantastic bar to check out in SF that's also very conveniently located.
author: Bryson L.

description:
Stumbled upon this place directly across from our hotel in the Civic Center area thanks to Yelp. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but for tired tourists hangry from a full day of travel this place hit the spot. 

The interior is very modern and clean with seat yourself service at the bar about 5 high top tables and some long couch benches that run along the wall. Our group of 3 was lucky to find 2 stools at the bar and the bartender was kind enough to grab a 3rd from a back room for us to squeeze in. 

The beer selection is great with about 20ish brews on tap, many of them local to California. They also offer a pretty good wine selection. I stuck with the Huckleberry - a tart cider with a sour aftertaste...big fan! 

I tried the duck tacos and a side of fries with scallion aioli, with my dinner companions opting for the vegan burger and the chicken torpedo. Those fries with the aioli.....so SO good! Tacos were okay and my pals enjoyed their meals. We can back here for a second time during our visit for dinner and drinks once again as it was one of the most reasonably priced places in the area. The second time I went with the brisket burger and fries and it was a great meal. 

If you are looking for a no fuss place with tasty food and good drinks without the outrageous touristy price gouges, give Fermentation Lab a try.
author: J W.

description:
Probably one of my favorite places in SF to get a good burger. I believe they serve their burger over a brioche bun and usually give you a side of salad or a small order of fries with your order. Definitely one of the up and coming spots on Market and it's right next to the Orpheum. Only con about this place is the fact that there's very very VERY limited seating but alas, it's SF. 

This place gets a 5/5 for it's great selection of craft beers and wine if you're feeling a bit classy. BUT the star of the show goes to their duck fat fries. DUCK. FAT. FRIES. Three things that would on their own dangerously send anyone in their mid 50's to a visit with their cardiologist. The fries are cut like steak fries. Also, you can definitely taste the duck fat because it's a unique taste. If you're ever craving fries, this is the place to go.
author: Richard Cornelius T.

description: On jury duty and never really make a point to visit the Civic Center area when eating out. I would totally stop in this place for lunch with a few coworkers. Food is fantastic, extensive beer selection, and adequate seating for a few people. Wish these places had a little more space, but definitely a nice place to stop in for a random lunch or drink mid-day.
author: Zach L.

description: I love this place! Great beer selection, great atmosphere. Truly a hidden gem. The bartender was super nice and the beers are moderately priced. I didn't try the food, but i heard it was good.
author: Moira D.

description: I go here all the time!!! Great service! Amazing food! Bad ass beer selection on tap! All local!! Highly recommend!!
author: Christy M.

description:
Came here a couple nights before to grab dinner before heading to bars after I saw the amazing reviews this place got. This is mainly a beer bar with tons of flavors on tap. It's small and cozy and a great place to grab a bite and drink. Unfortunately we did not want to mix later that night and decided to opt for the food only. We ordered:

* duck fat fries- these were good but nothing spectacular or different compared to normal fries

* fried chicken burger - this was delicious and the chicken was tender and crispy. They did give a huge portion and this dish also came with fries.... so might've had a very hard time finishing 

* chicken tenders- I did not try it but my friends said this was really good as well


Overall the food and service was great, I just wish it was in a better area and less sketch to walk to, or else great spot!
author: Prasiddha H.

description: Good gastropub right on Market St near Civic Center so pretty convenient to get to. Excellent beer list with a huge variety of beers on tap from hazy IPAs so stouts. Order at the bar. Good food selection as well (no waiter, order at bar and get a number). Pretty good chicken sandwich and fries. Overall if looking for a good beer and some food, check this place out.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Great new place to pass the time when you're in the area. I gotta give this place a closer to a 4.5 than 5.  My group and I were lucky to nab one of the couch areas, but if we didn't I'd probably rate it a bit lower since the space is limited, especially during a Friday afternoon. We came early because we wanted to kill time before Hamilton and it was fine between 5-6PM, but starting around 6:30 people ended up walking out after not finding a place to sit or stand. 

| LOCATION | 

Close to Bart/on Market so it's easy to get to. It's easy to miss though since it's a small location and they only have their logo on the window. 

The inside of the place is quite narrow with a corner couch section to the left of when you walk in and in the back. They have a couple bar seats and a few 2 seater tables lining the wall. The bathrooms are all the way in the back, but for the most part they were quite clean. Even though the place got packed, it wasn't crazy loud where I couldn't hear someone in my group speaking. They do a good job of also keeping the doorway clean and making sure that people can get from the front to the back area. 

| FOOD | Both $14 & came with an option of fries or salad. You also order your food/drinks right at the bar and they give you a number and bring it to your table. 

- Chicken Sandwich - I wasn't a fan of this. They do give you a large portion of chicken in the middle but i'm not used to having my sandwiches with cheese. My BF enjoyed the slaw they had on the top, but it was too spicy for my liking. 

- Smoked Cheddar Cheeseburger (originally $12 but additional items are $2 each) - Can't go wrong with this. It seems like a fave since I saw a ton of people order it. The meat was nice and juicy, tasty cheese, and the acme bun delicious! They add the aioli on the bread, but as for the rest of the condiments like the tomatoes, arugula, pickles, etc they put it on the side so you can add it to your burger yourself. 

- Fries - Nice cut steak fries! They were fried to perfection without being dried out. 

- Dungy Roll ($20) - My friend tried this and said it was good, but could have been better without the egg on top. The bread held up well with the sauce, but you could tell that the juices were seeping through the bread and that it wouldn't be good later. 

| DRINKS |  All drinks were reasonably priced between $6-$8 & they had a decent selection

- Huckleberry Cider ($7) - I've never tried this Two Rivers brew so I was excited to try it. As with other ciders it tastes like juice, but that's the appeal. I really enjoyed this since it was sweet but not overpowering and at 6.5% your girl can't complain! 

I also tried my friends pineapple/berry sours and they were pretty tasty! The pineapple was definitely more acidic and a little too much in my opinion so i'd opt for the other one since it's more subtle. Others in our group got IPAs such as Pliny the Elder and agreed that the hype is worth it! It's great that they had this on tap because other places are pretty limited with their stock.

| SERVICE | 

Pretty hands off since you order right at the beginning. The silverware/napkins are on the table and they bring you the ketchup, etc when they bring the food to the table. They do come by often to clean up empty plates and cups which is nice.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Stopped by this bar before planning to watch Aladdin at the Orpheum with a friend. 

We were able to snag a table in the back. The bartender was attentive as soon as we walked in. We ordered a couple drinks along with the cheese board. 

It came with a variety of cheeses, honey, nuts and something we assumed were beets? Whatever, we ate it. 

Their beer variety was great and they had wine and champagne as well. Great place for a drink!
author: Rosa P.

description:
Good place for a quick bite and a beer.  Coming from Pittsburgh to San Francisco for business and having not done any research of the area I was staying I am happy with my find.  Fermentation lab overall was a solid choice and for craft beer fans this place won't wow you, but will satisfy your cravings.
The space is small and was packed when we first went in, I am fine with this so long as I eventually get a comfortable seat and I did.  The service was pretty quick and cordial. Bonus when they remember your name for adding beers to the open tab.  I really get frustrated when a place isn't packed and the same bartender needs to ask 2-3x's what your name is.
Since this is a beer centric bar I will comment on their tap list.  A well curated tap list to me beats out the places with 60+ beers on tap any day. Fermentation Lab did just this, 20ish beers, 3 that I was interested were kicked unfortunately, but that's fine.  They had classics, sours, dark/rich stouts, pale ales, and New England style IPAs.  They also keep it as local as possible another bonus. Beers were also served in glassware that reflected the style and was thoroughly cleaned.
Onto the food.  I first ordered the duck fat fries. The fries were the thick cut steak fries that are too often underdone.  These fries were crispy and had a good season to them, but something was underwhelming.  They were good while drinking a hazy ipa, but I wasn't at all wowed and if I should ever go back would probably try something else.  For my main course I grabbed the duck tacos.  They were the star of the show.  Real tortillas and two of them moped up the saucy duck and pickled veggies.  This was a rich 4-6 bite meal.  Satisfying and glad I had moved onto a crisp pilsner to clean the richness off my tongue.
author: Josh C.

description:
I went to try the brisket burger and beer. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich, instead, and the other ordered the burger. I liked the sandwich more!

The ratio of chicken to other ingredients in the sandwich and to the bread was perfect. There were just enough veggies and sour sauce to perfectly complement the fried chicken's flavor and texture. I don't usually eat bread, but I ate (most of) the bread. Each bite elicited a satisfied "mmmm" from me. This has become my current fave fried chicken sandwich!

And it isn't just the chicken sandwich I would go back for. The duck fat fries are not to be missed! In addition to yummy duck fat taste, they have a bit sweetness... and I love that salty-sweet. 

The restaurant/bar itself is unassuming and no-frills. It's located in an area I don't often find myself in, but it was worth venturing out there for the bar food.
author: Jennie Y.

description: We loved this place! Such a chill and calm place. The beers are amazing. The service is good too. Recommend this spot. Our server Nick was awesome! We loved him!
author: Yari M.

description:
I used to live right around the corner from here but sadly they weren't open at that time. It seems like a pretty new spot, maybe under 6 months old? 

They have an awesome combination of a really nice food menu and a fantastic beer list (plus some wines and sodas). They had Pliny the Elder on tap (like every other time I've tried it, I thought it was good but overrated for all the hype) and lots of other great options. Everything is more or less local, from SF or the North Bay or the East Bay with a few from a little further but still in CA. I found what is possibly my new favorite beer here- Le Merle by North Coast brewing which was an awesome saison. Really really good. 

Food wise they have a bunch of interesting stuff- house cured salmon, duck, crab, charcuterie, cheese, fried chicken, and more. I decided to try their burger and added bacon marmalade for a $1. Very solid burger and at $12 the price was perfect too. Delicious Acme bun, some lightly seasoned arugula, super fresh tomatoes, a little scallion aioli, and the bacon marmalade which was really delicious. The actual party could have used a little more flavor and seasoning but with the other components, it was an awesome burger. I would get this again or try the other menu options as there was a bunch of things that sounded intriguing. The burger comes with fries or a salad; I opted for the fries. Thick cut steak fries, a lot of the other people seemed to really like this but I thought they were just ok- I wished they were again a little more seasoned and crispier. 

It is a pretty small spot and quite busy so you may have to wait a bit to find a seat or stand. They've done a nice job utilizing the space they have though and it doesn't seem crazy crowded or anything. Not great for huge groups but if you have 5 or fewer people you can probably find a spot. 

I would probably give them somewhere between 4 and 5 stars based on my initial visit. I'm definitely happy I stopped by though and would come back for sure.
author: Seema U.

description:
Good selection of beers and good food. You can only order at the bar, including food, but the service is quick and friendly, so I wasn't missing a waiter. It was pretty crowded on a weeknight, so maybe hard to come here with mor than 3 or 4 people.

Whenever a place serves the impossible burger, I have to try it--so far have had it at crossroads and umami burger in LA. I ordered the impossible burger with fries here, and it was soo good. Based on other reviews, it looks like their normal burgers are good to. Will make sure to try that next time I come here!
author: Tanu S.

description: The impossible burger is insanely good here. The carmalized onions and the crispy soft bun is perfect. I was eating with my friend and could not stop talking about how good it was. Never had a burger that good. I'd recommend even meat eaters try it.
author: Dewayne P.

description:
New place to add to my go to food places! My friend and I walked past the Fermentation Lab since a couple outside was blocking the window signage.  We knew that when we had passed Sam's Diner, that we had gone too far. 

We walked in and looked at menus on a barrel that also indicated that you should order at the bar. I decided to get their chicken Sandwich and my friend ordered their burger. We grabbed a two person table towards the back and then got our water. There is a water dispenser towards the front as well as ketchup, napkins, and utensils. 

It didn't take long for our food to come out. Once it did, we both went after the steak fries first. Think Red Robin's but better seasoning! However, one bite of the chicken sandwich with it's perfect aioli and coleslaw mixture left the fries forgotten. I hadn't thought I was hungry and am generally a slow eater but the tang of the coleslaw mixed with a bit of spice from the chicken or aioli made this one of my favorite chicken sandwiches!

The staff were extremely friendly. The gender neutral bathrooms were clean. The restaurant got busy quickly around 6 pm on a Saturday night. We didn't order any drinks but everyone around us did and they looked like they were enjoying it. The sound level is average. Definitely a place I'll return too!
author: Olivia C.

description:
Snack + drinks review. 

Duck confit sliders - 5/5
Clam bacon marmalade chowder - 4/5

Beer selection ++

Overall, "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
Stopped by this spot waiting for a show to start and some friends to pop by. The guys behind the counter are helpful and attentive. Off to the side, there was a TV playing soccer as time went by. Lots of randoms end up coming through based on location so it works really well if you're into people watching. The place is pretty well divided with the bar at the front having single seats, some double seats along the side and back, and a couch in the back for a larger group. The place is certainly designed for transients.

I had also ordered the duck fat fries aside from getting a few beers. Those had good flavor to them, cooked well, and the aioli that came with it worked well. No complaints, I'd probably stop in again to kill some time.
author: David C.

description:
Not going to lie I was pretty adverse to coming here every time my friends suggested it.  I am not a fan of fermented foods and I thought that was what we would get into. I just can't enjoy the puckering sour face feeling of anything fermented.  BUT I think the fermented also was referring to the wide selection of beers! We ended up ordering:
- Cobb salad
- fermented veggies
- chicken sandwich
- brisket burger
 
All of this paired with a side of duck fat fries!  heavens, the duck fat fries at first bite you can taste the duck flavor oozing out.  The first couple were delicious but then it was too much overload of duck oily fat.  Still really tasty.  All the food was surprisingly better than I had anticipated. 

The service is more of a chill vibe, they are chitchatting and not really paying too much attention or asking people if they need something. When they did help they were pleasant.
author: Michelle T.

description: This is a great place to come before a show at The Orpheum. Good food and a great variety of beer.
author: Shelley S.

description:
First of all, as a prior chemist nerd, I very much like how this establishment is called the Fermentation Lab. I never got a chance to ask if they actually create their own EtOH beverages here--seems too small of a space. Either way I know they can sell me some fermented/refined liquids to get me to that state of mind where nothing matters.

At any rate, this joint was quite a find since it's right on Market St. around Civic Center! I honestly didn't expect such a clean/trendy bar. It's the perfect spot to just drop in, grab a classier-than-normal drink and head out. Or, if you're like me, you can grab some foodage too. I remember having some lobster deviled eggs and a chicken sandwich--one app and one entree was good for 2 skinny Asian people painting the town red.

When I'm back around Civic Center, inevitably, I'll probably drop by here again to appreciate more of their craft cocktails and food!
author: Marlon T.

description:
After searching in yelp, i stopped to FERMENTATION LAB for a quick bite ..before catching the BART and walked around the block to find the door, ( based on the location shows in yelp)
 This place looked clean and neat, with clearly posted details of what they offer, music, TV, a chef dressed neatly (reminded me of TITANIC captain ‍:), and Jaqob, a nice gentleman who will welcomed me and helped to pick.
I ordered chicken bites ...  asked for hot sauce; he offered several options,... I picked The Pepper Plant (CA Style), 
Oh boy
I love dryer food than watery/ moist due to Acid...
It was AMAZING!!!SUPER AMAZING
I broke my restriction of limitations for food It was SO good
I don't remember the last time I brook it. 
I had to order the second that comes with Arugula and especial sauce 
Still less calories than fast food for two orders 
Great fresh quality chicken breast bites and a sweet and sour sauce 
I'm picky, and know the quality of food; as I am a (self appointed;) chef and food critic ‍ for dozen of countries around the world(3/5 continents). My Neighbors orders looks great and they were regular costumes, I'll try it next time.
I am thankful for great quality and service, and will come back with friends and family.
 
Keep up the great job!
author: Amir S.

description:
I wasn't quite ready to go home after seeing a show at the Orpheum. I ran into Peter L outside and we decided to go grab one more drink. After doing a quick search, I picked Fermentation Lab. We walked in on Wednesday, March 11th around 11pm.

*Belgian: Le Merle, North Coast, Fort Bragg, 7.9%, 16oz ($7)
*Session Blonde: Foam Top, Beachwood, Long Beach, 5.5%, 16oz ($6)
*Pilsner: Free Kittens, Berryessa, Winters, 5.5%, 16oz ($6)

I actually wanted to try the Redemption, but they were out, so I got the Le Merle per the bartender's recommendation. Now I'm not really versed in beer at all, but I thought this was okay. Good for sipping since we were there for almost two hours. I ended up splitting the Free Kittens with Peter as my second drink. I actually enjoyed this more, so maybe I'm more of Pilsner girl?

Fun place to try some beers. The kitchen closes before 11pm, so we weren't able to sample any of the food here. I think that's a good excuse to come back. Plus, I can finally try the Redemption.
author: Elena N.

description: Came here before catching a show at the Orpheus just across the street. Great selection of beers, good bar food as well. Can be a bit crowded as it is a limited space. Would recommend.
author: Ronnald M.

description:
An ideal place to kick it with the boys on a Friday night after work.

This place is for sure a beer bar, with a large selection of beers on tap. The beers lean towards being craft vs. your typical draft that you see at a dive bar, which means smaller pours but more interesting flavors. 

What was surprising was the food - the chicken sandwich + duck fat fries blew me out of the water. I didn't even order it; my friend was the one who wanted to eat and when he took the first few bites he said "dude. you gotta try this chicken sandwich." If I was looking to make those gains I would have for sure ordered two.

If you're looking for a casual place to chill after work or during a business trip, this small establishment is ideal. Remember: order that chicken sandwich + duck fat fries.
author: Albert C.

description: Who would have known that such a cool beer bar would offer lunch Monday through Friday from 11:30-2? So delicious. Their lunch menu is great and the bartender who works the lunch shifts would be so handsome if it wasn't for his stupid bun. I over heard him say that he was really good at chess so maybe if i feel brave enough i'll challange him sometime, i'm sure he'd love that. Anyways, i always get the impossible burger, the way the cooks carmelize the onions is super tasty. I'll probably be back sometime soon, it just depends on my schedule.
author: Stefan S.

description:
I came here with my friend after work on a Thursday evening and managed to snag one of the last available tables. The location is pretty small and the lighting is quite dim, but I can definitely see it getting popular in the future when more people find out about it, especially because they sell Pliny the Elder! 

My friend and I both ordered flights of beer, with Belgians, IPAs, stouts, and porters, but we liked the lighter beers the best. Pliny the Elder was easily our favorite, with the floral tones masking the usually hoppy flavor of IPAs. We also liked the Tiburon Blonde and the Russian River Redemption, but felt that the porters and stouts we tried were either a little watery or had a weird fragrance.

We also had the fries with scallion aioli which was so good we ordered a second bowl LOL. I usually am not a huge fan of thick cut fries, but these were so crisp on the outside and fluffy inside, and the scallion aioli was buttery and flavorful. Highly recommend this!!

Pricing is pretty reasonable, especially considering the pours were pretty large for the flights. The storefront is a bit nondescript so you need to keep an eye out for it, but I would definitely come back to try out more of the local craft beers!
author: KC W.

description: Great beer, decent sour selection, they had a melon gose I haven't been able to find anywhere in a while. Beers are local, food smelled and looked good, busy bar for 5p on a weekday
author: Elaine P.

description: Awesome place!!! Good beers, good service and awesome vibe!!!!! Excellent location by bart and hotel whitcomb!!! Visiting from Hawaii if we visit again we will be back for sure!!!
author: Geoff M.

description:
Craft beer in the Civic Center Area.  Oh if you are a tourist, this is an oasis between the Burger King and the let's say not so tourist friendly surroundings.

They have a selection of craft beers that are really prevalent in my current hometown, San Diego.  Although it can't compete with craft beer selection in SD, you can't actually fault them, they have provided a service in this area that is as mentioned, a needle in a haystack.  If you are from out of CA, it's a nice place from the hustle and bustle of Union Sq and all it's busy touristy spots.

Located across the Hotel Whitcomb (a place I have stayed at), it probably gets some of their guests and tourist who wander off the beaten path.  Foodwise, they have some nibbles but I wouldn't consider it a dining destination.  Enjoy your beer and nibbles and find another place for a full meal.  They do serve burgers (vegan one too) so if' that's your go to meal, then it's fine (but it's SF - you have a wealth of options).

Recommended for my fellow tourists.
author: Melanio F.

description: Cool vibe. Super clean and crisp and modern. You order at the bar which makes it very laid-back and easy. Excellent selection of draft beers. Food was also very good. The impossible burger in particular was really enjoyable. I would definitely recommend this place for somebody who is looking to relax and enjoy a drink and/or some food.
author: Molly F.

description:
Got into their soft opening by a long shot association...but they're all super nice and welcoming here! The decor is hipster industrial with their exposed hvac and stoney tiles. 

They have a ton of beers to choose from and...oh my god, Pliny the elder is one of them! Along with that they have a decent snacks/heavy snacks menu. We were able to try the duck sliders, reg sliders, an AMAZING bisque with lobster, some pickled accompaniments, and 2 kinds of deviled eggs (lobster.. and I'm not sure). 

This place totally fits into its SOMA location and I'm just glad I got to experience it before all the Twitter Twatters flood the place. A great new addition to the neighborhood!
author: Angela L.

description:
Great little beer place, and almost always packed. You can usually find one of the small nook tables free after a few minutes though.

The bar food looks solid and it's right by the theaters, so grab a bite here before your show!
author: Kevin L.

description:
The perfect place for pre-orpheum-show bar bites and drinks!! Sadly, no liquor though...only beer and wine. Poop.

Originally planned on going to Alta CA a couple blocks away, but when we got there, windows were taped up like the business closed. Bad, Yelp. 

But things ALWAYS happen for a reason, 'cuz we found this lil spot just a half a block away from the SHN, on our way to see Aladdin in it's last weekend here in SF. *sad face*

We ordered: duck fat fries, duck tacos, and crab deviled eggs.

I can't say one bad thing about the food, duck tacos were mind-blowing and the duck fat fries were....well, steak-cut potatoes fried in duck fat and come w/ aioli and yellow pepper ketchup. How much more YUM does that sound?! The crab deviled eggs were good, but I realize seafood and deviled eggs are not in my personal flavor forté. Next time I'll get them w/ bacon, because duh...bacon.

Great location in relation to The Orpheum?
Check!
Nice, busy-city, bar atmosphere?
Check!
Tasty food, good libations, and fast service?
Check, check, and CHECK!

Need I say mooore???...

I'll DEF be back.
author: Crystle F.

description: A very relaxing and hip place. Its minimalistic design is clean and welcoming. As imagined due to location and small size, it gets very busy. We were there on a Tuesday night and the whole place was full. They have a very generous beer list, and the food itself was delightful. The staff were very kind as well.
author: Mackenzie M.

description:
Have been twice for early happy hours.
Really like the interesting beer selections and the food is super good too. Had duck fat fries (uhm, yes!) and charcuterie and thought they were really tasty. Has definitely become a go-to spot after work!
author: R S.

description: Overall an excellent experience. I had a beer, the pickled vegetables, and a chicken bites. Everything was good and I especially enjoyed the spice of the vegetables. It is a great spot to come a get a drink at.
author: Joseph B.

description:
I really love this place. So much so that I treat myself during work to cover my tabs. I know that most ppl would go for the Fermented Items yet the ones, I've had are great, I go for the food! I have had The Impossible Burger ,  Fried chicken sandwich, the duck fat fries, the Fish tacos and a lot of other food selections. They are all good and I often go back and forth with what to order. 
Often kind of a dry area for food, this is an awesome Addition! It is so good and the staff is really cool and helpful!
author: domenique c.

description: An intimate cool and chill setting to take a date for a drink or something to eat. I had the cheese stuffed peppers and they were good. The staff was friendly and their service superb. This place I would recommend to anyone who's looking for a nice chill spot.@
author: Everett A.

description: The beer list was really nice. The impossible burger was good. Maybe delicious. I don't know.
author: Andy S.

description: Yes. You should come here. I met a friend and tried a boysenberry sour, the pickled vegetables, the crab deviled eggs, the snack mix, and the olives. Everything was delicious. Service is also nice, and the space is great.
author: Laura C.

description: Excellent place to enjoy a light dinner before a show. Groovy atmosphere, fun and eclectic menu. Crowded by exciting. We will return.
author: Ted L.

description: Loved how easy it was to find good seats, grab a delicious beer, and just chat. I like it easy what can I say... this old back ain't getting younger and these ears aren't hearing yanny no mo.
author: Grace K.

description: The food was pretty good...burger and salad with fried chicken was probably closer to 3 stars, but bumped up a star for variety of local beers and ciders.  I'll be back for apps and drinks!
author: Janelle F.

description:
Seating is decent for large groups but keep in mind there are only two sections to accommodate more than 6, one in the front and one towards the back

Beer selection is great from local breweries to well-known ones but not serving the usual suspects

Service was efficient and the crowd was fun

Overall Thoughts

A solid tip top spot to grab a beer with friends
author: Eddie W.

description: Great beer !  Many local and California beers to choose from. Close to civic center BART.  They even have an up the minute sign that tells you when your next train is coming.  I sat next to a gentleman who was eating a tasty looking burger.  I will be back.
author: Travas P.

description: Cool atmosphere.  Cool vibe. Nice bartenders and good beer. Enjoyed the time  - recommended
author: Lyndon G.

description:
This place is stephakiss approved!!!! I came here after Hamilton so I was already in a pretty great mood in general.

So many great beers to satisfy my hipster beer needs. Great IPAs, lots of sours, and more! The bartender was awesome and suggested a good IPA for me, after listening to me describe what I want in my IPA (I don't know if you can tell, but I love IPAs). 

The interior decor was so modern and sf. Couches in one area and nice small tables for pairs. 

They also have a cute menu where they turn the sign for each beer upside down when they're our for the night.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Incredible beer selection with affordable and delicious food!  Great bar but it is definitely a crowded space, so be prepared to be patient or cross your fingers that you come at the right time.  At one point it looked like there was a line out the door just to order at the bar!

It took my friends literally 10 minutes just to decide on which beer to try since there were so many wonderful options.  I also really like the beer flight idea and will definitely get it next time because it basically gives you four half-pours for the same price of $14.

The food took a while to come out but it was well worth the wait.  We ordered the Burger and the Chicken Sandwich.  Both were delicious, filling, and surprising in flavor.  The fried chicken strips were crispy and the combination of the spicy slaw and aioli was a perfect combination.  I think each of them were about $10 too which is pretty ridiculous for a good meal in San Francisco.

Wonderful night out and I will definitely return!
author: Jess Y.

description: Seriously one of the best burgers I've ever eaten. Do yourself a favor and get the aged cheddar and avocado. Splurge on the bacon if you're feelin' it. Can't find good craft beer like this for these prices anywhere else in SF that I've found.
author: Aleesa P.

description:
Wow. Perfect timing... And I say that with the utmost sarcasm because my boyfriend used to live literally across the street from the Fermentation Lab, but we recently moved. It's kinda nice to be back in a familiar neighborhood before watching Hamilton, though the neighborhood itself isn't all that nice. 

As an architectural engineer, my boyfriend rarely compliments the interior of any restaurant or bar we visit (causing me to roll my eyes) but he actually admired the design of Fermentation Lab. I agree. So much variety of seating for such a small, narrow space. There's room at the bar, tall tables for two along the side, and group seating at the front and back. Luckily we were able to squeeze near the bar.

Seeing all the heavy dinner food that everyone was enjoying made me realize that we should have come here for our pre-musical meal instead of a separate restaurant, but the beer selection alone is impressive. I had a Pliny the Elder, but there were so many great options to choose from... Seemingly from all over California. 

The bartenders provided excellent service. There were even restrooms in the back. Fermentation Lab truly embodies everything a good bar should have. Even so, it's not one of my favorite bars in the city, but I highly recommend it. Very central location, right next to the Civic Center BART station.
author: Stefanie C.

description: First visit here. I liked the range of beers on tap as well as the food available. Pretty cool place to get a bite and beer.
author: Kushal L.

description: Read the reviews. Saw the photos and I was in there. I also am aware of the benefits of fermented foods and beverages. I had the House salad with salmon. It was so good. I ate it before I took a picture. Also tasted the fried chicken sandwich with fries, really good fried hard, lime I like chicken,  would definitely recommend both dishes. The fries are also fantastic.  Great relaxed, no stress atmosphere.  Also you order your food at bar, grab a seat and just chill. One suggestion is to get a banner or sign with the name so it can easily be located
author: Genie M.

description:
I think I love sour beers. And this is a sad realisation because I very rarely see them anywhere. But Fermentation Lab had 3 different sours on tap when I visited, and the two I tried were amazing. The IPA sample I tried was also very good, although the allure of the sour was too strong.

I was very pleasantly surprised with how nice this place was inside, and the bartender was really friendly and accommodating. Pretty chill vibe which I'd definitely recommend if you're in the area.
author: Joe B.

description:
I've never written a yelp review while still sitting in the establishment before, but this place is just so great! I've been working with my organization for Pride, so I came here yesterday - excellent food, great service, fun vibe. My coworker and I came here tonight after Pride ended, and we happened to be a dollar short for the Pride-event cover. The security guy let us in anyway. 

I thought that was so nice, so I told the bartender that I wanted to buy his security dude a beer. I went up to ask the bouncer what he wanted, and it turns out he's the OWNER - out there working security for his own bar on Pride night! He was so sweet and told me and my coworker to make sure we're safe tonight. what a gem. 

What a lovely place, especially after a long day. I totally encourage people to check it out.
author: Kate E.

description: I love the fermentation lab!! I often come for a late lunch or after work drink/snack.  There is a great selection of beer and the food is amazing.  The vegan "impossible burger" is very well done and they have a vegan macaroni and cheese.   What's not to love!!
author: Susan H.

description:
Went here late last night and loved it!

They have a freaking awesome menu! Bonchon, pickled veggies, cheese plate, salmoncuterie? What more could a girl want? Oh, besides something like Mac N' Cheese or Spaetzle. If they added that, I swear I'd be here all the time. 

The decor is nice, very modern and clean. The service was on point, too. I was so thirsty and I must have had about 5 glasses of water, and the server was like a ninja filling them up before I even noticed that I needed more. Food came out promptly also. 

Took off a star because they were out of a few items. I came here specifically to try the salmon plate that they had, but unfortunately they were out, bummer!

Other than that -- awesome place with a great concept!
author: Audrey M.

description:
Went here for dinner before a show at the Orpheum. Because we got there around 6 we were able to get a great spot on the couches before it got too busy. If you want to sit, come early. 

Food was fantastic, favorites being the pickle plate and fried chicken bites. We also had the cheese plate which was good but I could get those same cheeses at the store and the crab deviled eggs. 

Several beers and glasses of wine later we left satisfied.
author: Rachel C.

description: cute little place on Market near the Orpheum. We went in before a show and had a great meal for not too much money.  Lots of brews to choose from and I had wine. The food was on point with a good variety of bar treats.  The staff was great and really helped us make choices.  If you go on a show night, get there early because the seats fill up fast!
author: Dawn R.

description:
Great selection of rotating beers and well balanced light snacks. Recommend a hoppy pale ale if you don't feel like something too bitter or too light. Also, the Cobb salad with chicken strips has exactly something to satisfy your cravings before a show without the heaviness in your tummy. 
Ordered hoppy palm, hops of wrath, and gold digger with duck tacos and chicken strip Cobb salad.
author: Amy T.

description:
Amazing place nearby where I live. Need to order the food at the bar. The chicken sandwich was phenomenal. The vegetarian burger was great too but need to make sure you're a mushroom fan.

Totally delicious and will definitely be back!!!
author: Nadia H.

description:
Stumbled on this place last weekend and it's a great find!

They've got something like 20 (maybe more!) craft beers on tap plus some food options. I didn't get any food but want to come back to try as the dungy roll and cheese options looked awesome!

The bartenders here are awesome. They're super knowledgeable about their beer and are happy to help you pick a brew if you need it. Since there's no crappy beer on the menu you can't really go wrong but they will let you try a small taste before you commit. 

I tried one of their sour beers but settled on their blood orange cider, while the boy was super exited to see that they had Pliny the Elder on tap. 

It's definitely a cool spot with a good vibe and one to check out as soon as you can! It's not in the best neighborhood so I'd recommend going earlier in your night rather than later just so you don't feel uncomfortable leaving late at night.
author: Elliott W.

description: The Brisket Burger medium rare was so flavorful and juicy! Great selection of brews on tap. It was a great find to stop in before going to the show at the Orpheum. The food came quickly. The atmosphere is friendly. I will definitely come here again. Can't wait to bring my friends who love craft beer!
author: Laurie M.

description: Came here for the soft opening and one random night .Great location and choices of beer. The chef brought out a couple their sample dishes from the menu so we had a chance to try them out. The slider had a generous patty portion, tasty and cooked just right. The deviled eggs was a small bite but packed some big taste.  Their vegan burger- primarily a portobello mushroom is juicy and flavorful. Their beer selection from pliny the elder to my fave the Rapscalion from Social Brewery was the icing on the cake. Staff was attentive and overall a good ambiance. Definitely coming back- you should too! =D
author: Kai A.

description: Great for beer and late evening appetizers. This was the closest place across the Whitcomb hotel where we stayed. The beer selection was great! We enjoyed saison and sf hefe. For food they have quick bites - duck tacos were fabulous (with a little kick). I had a veggie burger with Portobello mushroom - was very yummy. Fries were awesome too. Service was great. Relaxing laid-back atmosphere. Kitchen closes at 9pm
author: Elena T.

description:
A quality gastropub with a fantastic, well-curated beer selection and a surprisingly solid food offering. 

The beers are Bay Area and California-centric, and run the range of styles, from cider to gose, wheat, IPA, pilsner, saison, and stout. The food offerings might look somewhat pricey on the surface, but you'll get good quality for what you're paying for, whether it's an appetizer of deviled eggs or something more substantial like a burger or a dungeness crab roll. 

Service can be hit or miss; there was one tall, lanky, geeky-looking blond bartender who seemed a bit aloof, while there was a more solidly built bartender who appeared to be either the manager or the owner and who was very friendly and attentive to his patrons.

A good addition to the continually gentrifying Mid-Market corridor.
author: Vincent L.

description: Landed the impossible burger. Very well prepared here. Tasty brews, pleasant surprise.
author: S H.

description:
Came for the beer, stayed for the surprisingly good food. 

Great selection of beers on tap are complemented by a full menu that I'll be exploring over time. We had the duck sliders and a salad, both of which were very tasty. Location on market makes it a handy and convenient place to meet friends or end a night out.
author: Jeremy Y.

description: Wrapping up a training session in SF and wanted to find a Craft Beer Joint that offered good selection of Local Beer and Food before I head South.  FL did not let me down.  Good selection of beers.  Duck Tacos are a must... Super Tastey...Staff was on point with descriptive knowledge of beers on tap and very customer oriented.
author: Michael V.

description: Today was my first lunch visit to Fermentation Lab. The lunch menu, thought small, is REALLY good. I have the Chicken Torpedo Sandwich, my friend had the Ahi Tuna Torpedo Sandwich, and another had the Impossible Burger. All dishes were really good, and my duck fat fries were perfect. I also like the selection of beer - I had the Devil's Hoard (Laughing Monk). It was rich and chocolatey - great recommendation from Jakub. Chef Neil does a great job, and it's a relaxed, laid back atmosphere playing some great tunes. All in all - a great lunch, guys!
author: Sean R.

description:
Pretty solid spot to grab a fancy beer after work or before/after an SHN show at the Golden Gate or Orpheum. It can be crowded, but never too much of a scene. I've never had trouble getting an order in though finding a spot to sit can be tricky. Bartenders are helpful with the recommendations and I enjoy that there were three sour options to choose from. mmmm...sours. Haven't tried the food, but there seemed to be some tasty-looking trendy things going by (hint: they pickled that) in addition to your standard cheese and charcuterie bar snacks.

Bonus points: They accidentally charged me for food when I never ordered or ate any. I explained this when I went to sign out and they fixed quickly and thoroughly explained how it would credit back and when. No back and forth or drama. Thanks for listening, awesome Fermentation Lab staff.
author: Nikki M.

description: Let me start off by saying my fiancé and I are sour snobs. We know good sours when we see them, and Fermentation Lab is no different. Not only are their sours good, they have a wide array of beers which would delight any beer connoisseur. Friendly staff, cool atmosphere, and bomb brews. Need I say more?
author: Jessica G.

description: This is a great spot to grab a beer and a bite before or after a show at the Orpheum, it's only steps away. This is a long narrow space dominated by a bar, with limited tables and a group seating area at the back. The feeling is industrial and modern. The beer menu is diverse, with a lot of focus on local breweries (hey HenHouse, nice to see you here). The friendly bartender let my Mom try a couple of stouts before making her selection. We also had their cheese plate and crab sandwich, both of which were delicious. We arrived early and scored a prime spot at the bar and were lucky to do so - by the time we left it was packed.
author: Christina R.

description:
Went here for my birthday.  Could not complain!  Nice environment, they could accommodate out large group, and had some delicious food and beers on tap.  I was delightfully surprised to see Pliny the Elder on tap, a beer that I had been wanting to try for quite some time!

I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone trying to get a quick beer and a pint.  The overall ambiance of the place was great.
author: Luc B.

description: I was totally fooled by their impossible burger.! The place is small but the food is fresh and delicious and the craft brews are refreshing.
author: Janelle H.

description:
Wow!! What an awesome place! The manager is a great guy. He made us feel right at home, suggested different beers based on our tastes, and let us try before we got a whole glass. The food was also delicious. We don't eat meat...the portobello burger was the best I've ever had & the Cobb salad was fresh! The lady next to me said the hamburger was the best she's had all year. 
It's clean, comfortable, and has plenty of seating.
author: Cortny R.

description: Huge selection of beers and a small, but diverse menu. Vegan and vegetarian options too. In a pretty rough part of town  but the beer makes it worth it. Excellent service. Casual, trendy, and intimate atmosphere.
author: Kacie L.

description: Great food and great beers on tap!!  Wish they were open longer both in afternoon and evenings :)
author: Mike D.

description: A friend and I happened to find Fermentation Lab while looking for a place to eat during a business trip. What a great find for good local beer and light bites. I'll agree with the other reviews on the duck tacos - excellent. The Charcuterie was a bit disappointing compared to many other places I've visited that offer the same. I'd recommend that they expand to a few different Charcuterie offers with other variety of meats. But I will definitely go back. Like most places, they will let you sample some of the beer before you select and the guys behind the bar had great  info about the selections. It was fun to "pop quiz" one of the guys and ask what 4 beers would he take in a flight if he had to pick. Small, comfortable, like a neighborhood bar but with the tasting room vibe.
author: Rick S.

description: Great selection of beers but even better staff. Super friendly and knowledgeable without coming off as snotty. Nice spot across from Orpheum and Hotel Whitcomb. Highly recommend.
author: Ryan M.

description: In general, I eschew drinking establishments with large mirrors.  With that trepidation in mind, I nonetheless, ventured in.  The beers are good.  Ordered the 'impossible burger.'  Now, I hadn't eaten much all day and I was under the impression that it would be some sort of giant ('impossible burger') but it wasn't.  That said, it was tasty.  I've also had the duck tacos which are great.  If I could give 4.5 stars, I would - just rename the burger to 'tasty burger' or something.  The beer menu is quality and uncluttered.
author: Mr. Miner X.

description: Thanks, Yelpers, for turning us on to this perfect brewpub after a show at The Orpheum.  The list of draft beers drew us in but we managed to score some great eats, too.  Do not be put off by the limited food choices.  Cheese plate was delightful. The delicious Dungeness crab sandwich included the BEST fries ever!  All was well-prepared and promptly served by friendly staff.  It gets crowded as the night goes on but so worth it!
author: Trish B.

description: Tasty burger.  Expected awesome fries- got good.  Place is super cute- tons of beers.  Much needed welcomed  venue in the mid market/tender-vic.
author: R G.

description: If you're into fermented food this is your place. Leading edge in great tasting food combinations of pickled perfection. Trending ambiance. Attentive staff. Busy energetic atmosphere. A really fun place to sit at the bar or grab an intimate table.
author: Linda H.

description: Great food, great beer! Perfect for a pre or post show as the Orpheum is a 2 minute walk away.
author: Ilaria K.

description: I love this spot. Phenomenal selection of local tap beers, with lots of new options all the time, and paired with tasty fare. The burger is killer, and you can't beat those thick french fries. The service is on point, friendly and knowledgeable, above and beyond! I'll definitely be coming back again and again for an early dinner or late afternoon drink.
author: jessica f.

description: I was excited for a much needed burger from this place today and was extremely disappointed by my medium burger having a raw center. Feeling sick and wish I didn't attempt to eat it. This place isn't about the food perhaps. Please check the temperature before sending out food.
author: Valerie B.

description: Great low key mid market beer bar ! Started coming here a few weeks ago on a whim , and keep coming back .... the beer selection is mostly made up of California micro brews (all priced very well) the food is also very good .. super nice staff w no pretentiousness !!
author: Micah W.

description: Visited Fermentation Lab with my husband and son before Hamilton and loved it! The service was friendly and efficient, the beers, wine and food were delicious and FL is only steps away from the Orpheum. I highly recommend the deviled eggs with Dungeness crab , the fried chicken sandwich and the Dungy roll. He space is small and fills up quickly, so if you're seeing an 8pm performance at the Orpheum, get to FL by 5.30pm to get a table or a place on the sofa.
author: Shirley M.

description:
This is a great place for beer and bites - but be warned at popular times it's seriously packed and loud - be under 30, hip, trendy and enjoy crowds, fighting for the attention of the bartender and noise levels in the 100dB range. For other demographic segments, not so much.
Pre-theatre drink: maybe, if you can get one.
And the contrast is interesting with Market Street squalor just outside the door.
author: Neal S.

description: Craft beer in the Civic Center area - honestly, what more could you ask for? Check it out.
author: Michael T.

description: Fermentation lab is awesome. Love their selection of beers. Food is always on point, love the deviled eggs and duck sliders! I've been here many times and the staff is always friendly and the service is good no matter how busy they get. I love coming here to get bites and drinks before going out dancing.
author: Julie N.

description:
Such a cool new bar/gastropub in civic! The atmosphere is warm and inviting and the food was very good (fries are a must!!). Plus you get a hearty portion neither of us could finish the entire plate. Plenty of drink options from beer, cocktails and wine. Not a place for large groups but great for a date night or small groups (2-4).

Go now before everyone catches on to this cool new place!
author: Sarah R.

description:
Great feel for this new beer hangout. The space, though long and narrow, has plenty of space to hangout with friends. This is a great new addition to the area that has a breadth of food choices: high-end to diner to fast food. 

If you are a beer person and want some good food with the "hipster" vibe, this place is for you.
author: Bruce R.

description: Stumbled on this place by accident because I usually try to catch happy hour next door. Since the place changed their times to end HH earlier, thought we would give it a try. First of all, impressive ambiance - spacious enough for a small group of friends to gather and have a few beers. They have about 5-6 small tables lined up on the side to accommodate a pair of guests as well as a few sofa couches. Of the 2 times that I've visited this place, they always had the dubs game showing on the TV which is a huge plus. As for their beers, they have a pretty good selection with plenty of variety to chose from. The bartenders have been very knowledgeable of the times that I had questions. I will be returning here when I have the opportunity and would also recommend this place to anyone.
author: Chris D.

description: This place simply is the best bar in the area. Amazing vibes. Bartender was super rad and the drinks are nothing but phenomenal!
author: Sebastian G.

description: Excellent choice of beers and close to Bill Graham for a pre-concert drink or two. I'm always looking for sour beers and they had three good ones on tap when I was there. It was busy around 7:30 on a Saturday but actually calmed down a little later and wasn't too hard to find a table. Highly recommend checking this place out if you're into good beer.
author: Carey W.

description:
so utterly hipster I wanted to puke! a great place to grab a beer and a snack, but wouldn't want to bring the family or any party larger than two. uncomfortable seating and kind of a tiny joint. 
we ordered the bacon deviled eggs (amazing!!) and the brisket burger (delicious) but were uncomfortable eating the entire time.
author: Kathleen K.

description:
Nice, solid bar and pleased to have something fun and not divey in this part of town which is not the most well known for it's high class establishments and local...patrons. 

Solid and extensive beer list covering even the most discerning of pallets.

Nice food selection though have only ever eaten from apps / small plates section to nosh on while having a swift beer or two.

Barman with the septum ring has zero personality and sort of ruins the fun and happiness of the place.
author: David J.

description: Our neighborhood really needed a place like Fermentation Lab! It is directly across from my work, I now have a spot to get not just craft beer but local! The interior is pretty cool, it's narrow and has reclaimed wood on the walls with mirrors and lounge areas too. I just love how they have local craft beer. 24 beers on tap. They have some of my FAVORITES: Fieldwork and Russian River. It used to be really hard to get those beers but now that is not a problem! I mean really, it's so hard to find Russian River and Fieldwork anywhere. They also have actual food. Like really good food! I had the fried chicken sandwich which came with a spicy slaw. It was delicious. They also have yummy Duck sliders, cheese plates. And a TV. I'm just happy this place is here. Also a BIG PLUS: The staff knows beer. Love geeking out about beer!
author: luis m.

description: Excellent selection of beer. The bartender's are awesome and have great recommendations. Duck fat fries are incredible. If you're lucky they'll play the Mortal Kombat movie haha.
author: Christopher R.

description: No better spot for great variety of local brews and a mix of traditional and innovative food choices.
author: James R.

description: What a cool place. We sadly only had drinks, but that was excellent.  Our service was very good and pleasant.
author: G. K.

description: Good place to stop in for nice creative Brews. Definitely a beer place. Great selection of bar bites. Decent prices, good staff.
author: Anastasia C.

description:
Great new restaurant on Market Street. 
My family was going to SNH to see Rent tonite and found FL for dinner. 
The service was very good, food was yummy and lots of good beer and wine. Bet this place becomes a great go to spot for theater nights! Give it a try.
author: Eric C.

description: Can't say enough great things about this new place!  Great beer, wine and bar food.  We had the steak fries and the clam chowder soup, both were excellent.  Terrific selection of beers including amazing sour beers and many others.  Service was amazing as well as knowledgeable, we will be back!
author: Wendy B.

description: Very small but interesting menu, the beers are good, we tried a few.  It's in a bad part of town.  Not bad if you want to try some different beers with a group of friends in a casual atmosphere.
author: Catrina C.

description: Tasty food, interesting beer selection, but pretty pricey. They have quite a few taps of mostly CA breweries, but many are not the standard beers you see around town, so that's nice. The menu is kinda small, but the duck confit sliders were very nice and the crab deviled eggs (with a mango sauce and avocado) were really unique and flavorful. We also had a cheese plate which was pretty good. However, the prices are really steep, even for the area.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Visited while in town for a conference and ended up going back several times--great food, great beer and the staff was awesome at talking out the beer choices. Had my first Fieldwork IPA, one of the best beers I've ever had ... thanks FL.
author: Steve D.

description: Very thankful to find Fermentation Lab in the desert that is the Civic Center on Sunday evenings. Beautiful, sleek interior. Friendly and prompt service. The Cobb salad blew me away - fresh, tasty, and perfectly dressed. The volume got a bit loud a couple times, but my companion and I were still able to carry on a conversation. Would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Christine C.

description: Nice clean place with a good selection of beers on tap, wines, and from what I hear: great burgers.
author: Margot H.

description: Amazing craft beers, manager and staff were too shelf. My wife and I had the best experience tasting the best craft beers offered in California
author: Anthony L.

description: This probably one of the best beers establishments in the city! Staff is great, the food is delicious, and great ambiance! Love this place! Try the duck confit it's awesome!
author: Eduardo F.

description: Great beer list with some rare sours and local favorites.  Pliny the Elder on tap!  Bartenders were friendly and knowledgable, seating comfy and clean.  The food menu is carefully chosen and well suited to beer matching.  Fantastic addition to the neighborhood!
author: Jennifer M.

description: We wanted to find a place close to the Orpheum Theater for a couple of good beers and appetizers before a show. This place was perfect for that! The beer selection was extensive. I tried a blonde and a "citrusy" ipa that I really, really enjoyed. The appetizers we had were the deviled eggs with bacon (very good... also had a small sampling of their pickled veggies), the chicken bites (yummy sauce drizzled on top and the ranch dipping sauce gets a big thumbs up), the pork belly (this was ok... I liked our other selections better), and a cheese tray (a fantastic goat cheese) with crustini/honey/cranberries/nuts. I saw a lot of people ordering their burgers and they all seemed to be digging those (if I wasn't full from everything else, I think I would have tried one of those... they looked great). We sat at the bar (I think you have to order from there even if you don't sit there... but the place is small) and the guys serving everyone were fast and friendly. I'd go back here again if in the city for a show.
author: Kristin G.

description: I just enjoyed one of the best burgers I have ever tasted.  An Angus brisket burger,  perfectly cooked with dressed arugula and crispy,  hot French fries.  Bar food has reached a higher level here!
author: Tammy S.

description: Great beer selection and very knowledgeable bar staff, ask questions and tell them what you like. They will find your next favorite beer!
author: Ben W.

description: Great food. Great selection of beer. It was a little hard to find especially wandering the night streets of SF with all the crazy local folks late at night.
author: Mary H.

description: Wow. Great selection of beer, great food, killer prices and friendly staff. This neighborhood is officially on notice.
author: Helmut R.

description: This is my new go to place is SF off Market. Great selection of California beers, and awesome atmosphere.
author: Aaron B.

description: Came here before I saw a show at the Orpheum. It wasn't too busy though most of the tables were filled. I got the chicken sandwich and it was bomb. I also got a flight which wasn't on any menu but I saw it on yelp and someone in front of me ordered it. The only downside was they hadn't changed the signs of what was available on the walls so 2 out of 4 of my original choices for my flight weren't available. Had I known that ahead of time, I probably would've just gotten a glass instead of rushing to pick 2 more beers that I didn't end up liking.
author: Fiona K.

description: Every review of thus small restaurant was " right on".  Food was excellent and the selection of beers was incredible.  All this and a really friendly excellent staff.  Treat yourself to a fun, delicious meal
author: Eve S.

description: Nice neighborhood bar/food joint. The food is good. They have a nice selection of beers as well as wine. Service was good. Decor is nice. def will be rotation.
author: Amna I.

description: Great selection of beers. Cool spot to hang. Yummy deviled eggs and the fries with the green aioli were good. Their pear cider is delicious, tastes very fresh, haven't tasted a cider so good :)
author: Jessica H.

description: Delicious food! We especially loved the vegan and the chicken sandwiches! They have a very extensive and interesting beer list.
author: Hillary S.

description: such a chill place. it's super cool super hip but just the right amount. i like the dark ambiance the tvs the small cozy space makes you wanna get closer to whom ever you bring :P friendly baristas decent food lovely conversations. i wouldn't go here though if you are driving parking would be so crapolla
author: Reese A.

description: Hipster place in the midst of hookers and scammers! But, surprising great food and beer/cocktails. Pliny the Elder on tap.,, come on now!
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: We stayed across the street at the whitcomb hotel and loved this place. Great bartenders and the owner was very attentive. Loved the atmosphere, will visit again on my next trip to San Fran.
author: Deanna C.

description: Great small place to grab a beer and a bite to eat.  All the beers are from local craft breweries, and they have a good variety considering the small space.  We got the deviled eggs and the chicken sandwich.  The perfect amount of food to get us home.
author: JoAnn B.

description: Went here on a Thursday night at around 4:45 and by 5:15 it got really busy! They have great beer, food, and service! This place is so warm & cozy. As for food we both got the hamburger and it was amazing!!! We will definitely be back!! If your in the neighborhood you have to stop by.
author: Jes C.

description: Great pre or post show option in an area where there used to be nothing.  Went in on a Wednesday night.  Comfortable space to sit and great selection of beers.  Had run out of the hard cider option, hoping to try it next time.  My group tried the burger (amazing), fries (delicious) and chicken bites (just ok).  Could be difficult to get seating during busy times but well worth a visit during when its less crowded!
author: Tiffini C.

description: Great place to grab a drink before seeing a show at the Orpheum. Good selection on tap and the food is great too!
author: Taylor S.

description: Went here early on a Saturday. Great beer selection, fantastic service, food came out fast and was very tasty. Portions are filling but not huge. Will definitely go back.
author: Sam Z.

description: This is a great place. Great beers on tap and the staff was knowledgeable also. A little crowded but if you can get a seat enjoy the beers they have.
author: William M.

description: Cool spot to hangout after a show at the Orpheum Theater. Bartender was great with recommendations.
author: Toni T.

description: Great spot!! Good burgers, great beer! A hidden gem! A good spot to stop before a show/concert!
author: Natalie O.

description: Beer was excellent as was the food.  Service was a bit slow but it was a little busy on a Saturday evening.
author: JoAnn V.

description: Dope new spot downtown in the heart of SF. Has an amazing ambiance that's very intimate. Very gracious staff that's always welcoming. Beer selection is on point paired with some heavenly well priced bites.
author: Jose M.

description: This is one of those hole in the wall places you want to know about. The Stout on draft was flawless. The Chicken sandwich was amazingly crispy with a touch of spice. The fries are unpeeled potatoes, the way they are supposed to be. If the buns were 100% whole grain, they would rate 5 12 stars!
author: Rik C.

description: Unique but small food menu.  Good enough for a pub.  If you are brave enough to walk through some shady areas.  The microbrews are awesome!  Love that they dont give you a pound of French fries with your burger.  The pickled appetizers and cheese board was great too.  I had the Blood Orange cider-yum!!!
author: Kimberly C.

description: Loved the beer selection and their fermented array of dishes. Tried the Fruitlands Sour - quite fruity and their classic Veggie burger and the banchan. Bang for the buck!
author: Akanksha B.

description: Good service, great beer and really good nosh. Bit hard to find outside signage is minimal. Loved the chill vibe.
author: Cory C.

description: It was great as far as bars go... great selection of beer, and all things fermented--pickles, banchan, etc. Our table ordered the banchan, pickle platter, cobb, crab roll, and chicken sandwich. I didn't try everything that was ordered but we all enjoyed it. Very hard to see from the street, so keep your eyes peeled!
author: Laura D.

description: Great drinks, really good food, and amazing service. I would prefer if they had some more food options but I understand it's mainly a beer joint.
author: Dani F.

description:
We went by for dinner after seeing Hamilton!  They have a small menu for food and a huge menu for beer!  I had a sour and we ordered dinner.  The food came in reasonable short order and was great.  Finished it all and enjoyed the beer.  

It is the perfect pace to visit prior to going to the Orpheum or anything in the area.
author: Jeff R.

description: Great place, with people who know about beer and can give you an honest review of local beer on tap!
author: Marcela C.

description: My girlfriend and I had dinner and a few beers and we were very pleased. We tried the vegan burger with a side salad and fries. The Portable mushroom was very tasty, they were marinated and had a nice deep flavor . We tried three beers from beers and each one was flavorful. They have a nice selection ranging from dark to light.  The only negative thing was we couldn't see the sign for the restaurant and we past it a few times.
author: Jasmin t.

description: Great selection of craft beer. Tasty food. Really nice bartenders. Welcome addition to Market street.
author: Jamie M.

description: Great beer selection when you're hungry for tasty bites and IPAs (all microbrews looked so good!).  The duck sliders are a must try.  The dungy roll with fries was great too.  Ask for a side of the scallion aioli.   Glad to see another new place in the neighborhood!
author: George G.

description: Great food and beer list! Stopped by to grab a quick bite on the way to a friend's birthday, will be back! Had the burger and dungy crab sando.  Both were excellent! Was pretty calm for a Saturday night so it was easy to walk in and sit down.
author: Leanna R.

description: Jakob is at the bar tonight and is extremely friendly and helpful. The beer is amazing, the olive bowl is marinated by the chef, and it's shockingly good and easy to eat. It's clean and hip! LOVE IT!!!
author: Joseph S.

description: We went tonight after seeing a show. Food was great! The French fries were awesome and so was the Nicoise salad.  Loved all the beers on tap too!  In addition the staff was friendly and attentive! We will be back!
author: Felice R.

description: Amazing beer selection, great food, and awesome staff. The venue is a bit small, so not the most ideal spot for larger groups.
author: Misty B.

description: Great beer selection. Cozy quarters. Food I had was damn good. Fries could use a little help though...a little soggy and thick, though I prefer thin more crispy. Nice bartender too!
author: Matt G.

description: This a great beer lover's restaurant.   24 California  beers,  most of which  I haven't had and not all IPAs.   The food is wonderful and the staff is attentive,  friendly,  and knowledgeable
author: R T.

description: Had a couple if beers, the crab sandwich and the chicken sandwich. Both were super tasty. Its a small place so service was good and price was very reasonable for the quality.
author: Daniel A.
